title: Why not adding a ping meter to the client?
body: There is a lot of websites that do the same but no one is going to check their ping on a website before every game, so why doesn't riot add a ping meter to one corner of the client so everyone can see if they can play without lags or not. (Especially on ranked games where you HAVE to do your best if you want to climb up the ladder.)

replies.body:
When you join a Game after that riot chose a server and they all have different ping and one ping cant represent them all use this command in windows Run " ping 104.160.141.3 -t " its as close as possible to real ping
Edit: But riot can provide us a server list and all of pings they have and maybe be able chose from them

>
> When you join a Game after that riot chose a server and they all have different ping and one ping cant represent them all use this command in windows Run " ping 104.160.141.3 -t " its as close as possible to real ping
> Edit: But riot can provide us a server list and all of pings they have and maybe be able chose from them

Using the command prompt would be a good way to test the waters, but is not going to be accurate always. You should get a better ping in game than what the ping command reports though. The communication with the servers not always follows the normal route that your Internet traffic does. Riot has worked directly with internet service providers to route game traffic through paths that are optimal for the game experience.

If you want to get into the details (super technical), you can read:
https://technology.riotgames.com/news/fixing-internet-real-time-applications-part-i

We don't need it ti we accurate always. We just need it to see if it's a day with 150 ms of ping or 30. And if it displays 35 or 143, it doesn't matter, we can still know if our connection is in a good mood or not.
